message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.SC 

The paper deals with the verification of the correctness of imperative programs using constrained Horn clauses with linear arithmetic constraints. This topic is related to several areas of computer science, including logic (cs.LO), programming languages (cs.PL), software engineering (cs.SE), formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL), and symbolic computation (cs.SC). However, since the paper focuses on the transformation of constrained Horn clauses into linear clauses, which is a technique commonly used in logic and automated theorem proving, we consider cs.LO to be the most likely sub-category. The other sub-categories are also relevant because they involve topics such as program verification, formal methods, and automated reasoning, which are all related to the paper's content.
